metadata.Title: CVE-2022-29917 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Mozilla developers Andrew McCreight, Gabriele Svelto, Tom Ritter and theMozilla Fuzzing Team reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 99 andFirefox ESR 91.8. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruptionand we presume that with enough effort some of these could have beenexploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird <91.9, Firefox ESR < 91.9, and Firefox < 100.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-29917` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs91 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
